course_info:
PHY203: ELEMENTARY PHYSICS I (Fall 2024)
Instructor: Miquel Dorca
Office: 211 East Hall
Email: miquel@uri.edu
Office Hours: MWF 12:30pm - 1:00pm
Lecture Times: MWF 1:00pm - 1:50pm
Location: East Hall Auditorium

Course Description: Calculus-based introduction to Newtonian mechanics. Topics include kinematics and dynamics of particles and systems of particles, conservation laws, rotational motion, gravitation, and oscillatory motion.
Prerequisites: Credit or concurrent enrollment in MTH 141 and concurrent enrollment in PHY 273.
Intended for: Science and engineering majors.
Textbook: University Physics (OpenStax), 1st Edition, Volume 1. Available at https://openstax.org/subjects/science.
Brightspace: Used for class announcements and all lectures will be posted. Asynchronous lectures available on Brightspace if the course goes remote on November 25th, 27th, and December 2nd.
